title: MS in game doubled for 2 days and counting ?
body: so since my pc self updated to windows 10 iv had issues with my MS ingame, i already tried  the xbox settings thing and it did not work because the option to run off DvR recording was already off. this is really annoying seeing as i live about 3.5 hours away from your closest eastern server my Ms is normally 20-35 ms but for the last two days  no matter if its normal, a custom game, or bots my ms instantly  doubled then tripled  {exmaple: loading screen( 68-80 ms) then in game(85-135+ ms) }, my laptop is hard lined and i have a 75 MB connection( real time ranges from 70-80) iv already called my ISP to see if maybe they are having issues caused by the weather in the area, they told me yesterday all there services are working normal. Iv seen tons of complaints form the last 3 days  saying something to the affect of my ping is too high/lossing packets/ high ping in game but no resolved issues. im halfway through doing this again > https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#section-windows  for the second time, first time nothing worked , dropping 40 bucks on rp and having this happen the next day for 2 days is kinda of depressing id really like to get back in game.

replies.body:
If you've worked through our connection guide again (after the Win10 upgrade) and are still having issues, the problem may be along your network routing to our servers. In order to check this, we'll need to see a full traceroute log using [**WinMTR.**](http://winmtr.net/) After loading up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes+ has passed, you can export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

If you run into any issues, let me know!

after i posted i was on the step where you change your DNS i did that open cmd flushed restarted   and it worked for like 2 secs my ping went from 80 in loading screen to 50 but when the game loaded it jumped back up to 90-130+  im in the middle of reinstallign the game now after i will check if that didnt work ill run the test, thnx for the response ill keep you posted
That's really interesting that things changed for just a brief amount of time. Hit me back with an update once you test it again!

Ouch. It looks like your issue starts with a consistent 14% packet loss along most of your route, along with your latency (ping) continuously spiking to the mid 300s most of the way as well. I strongly recommend you reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support with these traceroute results so they can launch an investigation.

If you have any other questions, let me know.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=rxEfXT2c,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-30T04:23:56.654+0000)
>
> Ouch. It looks like your issue starts with a consistent 14% packet loss along most of your route, along with your latency (ping) continuously spiking to the mid 300s most of the way as well. I strongly recommend you reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support with these traceroute results so they can launch an investigation.
> 
> If you have any other questions, let me know.

 thank you very much i contacted my ISP they said it  saying it has something to to with a damaged cables outside they found it when they tried to read my connection, hopefully when they send ppl to fix it this will all be resolved,  thank you for the response.

so its about to go on 3 days (total of 6 for the whole post) now  and iv gotten no response to my mtr info there are tons of other ppl having  this issue and they all coming from the area around Michigan,ohio and illinois, iv been on other ppls post and some of them are getting ignored or getting marked as resolved just because a rioter has said" trying using are troubleshoot" but not help fix the problem or even inform us of anything , yet everytime i log into and look at the help and support there another new person saying the are having bad MS issues. can i get an update?? i jsut want to get this game running back to normal.
